alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 19 at 2:52AM EDT until March 20 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches, sleet accumulations up to one half of an inch and ice accumulations of one tenth to one third of an inch expected. Highest amounts of snow, sleet, and freezing rain in the Saint John Valley. * WHERE...Northeast Aroostook and Northwest Aroostook Counties. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 10 AM EDT Sunday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the ice. Travel could be very difficult.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory means that periods of snow, sleet or freezing rain will cause travel difficulties. Expect slippery roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.
